title: Mixed Bag for Big Banks, Tech Giants Face D.C. Scrutiny, Wall Street’s Cold Storage Grab Icing Out Foodie Startups
itunes:title: Mixed Bag for Big Banks, Tech Giants Face D.C. Scrutiny, Wall Street’s Cold Storage Grab Icing Out Foodie Startups
description:
Bloomberg News Finance Reporter Michelle Davis and Ken Leon, Global Director of Equity Research at CFRA, discuss bank earnings from JPMorgan, Wells Fargo and Goldman Sachs. Jennifer Rie, Bloomberg Intelligence Senior Litigation Analyst, talks about big tech companies like Google and Facebook testifying in front of a House antitrust panel on how dominant tech platforms affect innovation. Bloomberg Businessweek Editor Joel Weber and Prashant Gopal, Bloomberg News U.S. Real Estate Reporter, explain how private equity is snapping up refrigerated warehouses, which could make it harder for small food makers to sell their wares. And we Drive to the Close with Kate Warne, Investment Strategist at Edward Jones.

Hosts: Carol Massar and Jason Kelly.  Producer: Paul Brennan 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
